  16. ‌#define CAML_INTERNALS

  18. /* Handling of blocks of bytecode (endianness switch, threading). */

  20. #include "caml/config.h"

  22. #ifdef HAS_UNISTD
  23. #include <unistd.h>
  24. #else
  25. #include <io.h>
  26. #endif

  28. #include "caml/codefrag.h"
  29. #include "caml/debugger.h"
  30. #include "caml/fix_code.h"
  31. #include "caml/instruct.h"
  32. #include "caml/intext.h"
  33. #include "caml/memory.h"
  34. #include "caml/misc.h"
  35. #include "caml/mlvalues.h"
  36. #include "caml/reverse.h"

  38. ‌code_t caml_start_code;
  39. ‌asize_t caml_code_size;

  41. /* Read the main bytecode block from a file */

  43. ‌void caml_init_code_fragments(void) {
  44.   /* Register the main bytecode block in the table of code fragments */
  45.   caml_register_code_fragment((char *) caml_start_code,
  46.                               (char *) caml_start_code + caml_code_size,
  47.                               DIGEST_NOW, NULL);
  48. }

  50. ‌void caml_load_code(int fd, asize_t len)
  51. {
  52.   caml_code_size = len;
  53.   caml_start_code = (code_t) caml_stat_alloc(caml_code_size);
  54.   if (read(fd, (char *) caml_start_code, caml_code_size) != caml_code_size)
  55.     caml_fatal_error("truncated bytecode file");
  56.   caml_init_code_fragments();
  57.   /* Prepare the code for execution */
  58. #ifdef ARCH_BIG_ENDIAN
  59.   caml_fixup_endianness(caml_start_code, caml_code_size);
  60. #endif
  61. #ifdef THREADED_CODE
  62.   caml_thread_code(caml_start_code, caml_code_size);
  63. #endif
  64. }

  66. /* This code is needed only if the processor is big endian */

  68. #ifdef ARCH_BIG_ENDIAN

  70. ‌void caml_fixup_endianness(code_t code, asize_t len)
  71. {
  72.   code_t p;
  73.   len /= sizeof(opcode_t);
  74.   for (p = code; p < code + len; p++) {
  75.     Reverse_32(p, p);
  76.   }
  77. }

  79. #endif

  81. /* This code is needed only if we're using threaded code */

  83. #ifdef THREADED_CODE

  85. ‌static char ** caml_instr_table;
  86. ‌static char * caml_instr_base;

  88. ‌void caml_init_thread_code(void ** instr_table, void * instr_base)
  89. {
  90.   caml_instr_table = (char **) instr_table;
  91.   caml_instr_base = (char *) instr_base;
  92. }

  94. ‌static int* opcode_nargs = NULL;
  95. ‌int* caml_init_opcode_nargs(void)
  96. {
  97.   if( opcode_nargs == NULL ){
  98.     int* l = (int*)caml_stat_alloc(sizeof(int) * FIRST_UNIMPLEMENTED_OP);
  99.     int i;

  101.     for (i = 0; i < FIRST_UNIMPLEMENTED_OP; i++) {
  102.       l [i] = 0;
  103.     }
  104.     /* Instructions with one operand */
  105.     l[PUSHACC] = l[ACC] = l[POP] = l[ASSIGN] =
  106.       l[PUSHENVACC] = l[ENVACC] = l[PUSH_RETADDR] = l[APPLY] =
  107.       l[APPTERM1] = l[APPTERM2] = l[APPTERM3] = l[RETURN] =
  108.       l[GRAB] = l[PUSHGETGLOBAL] = l[GETGLOBAL] = l[SETGLOBAL] =
  109.       l[PUSHATOM] = l[ATOM] = l[MAKEBLOCK1] = l[MAKEBLOCK2] =
  110.       l[MAKEBLOCK3] = l[MAKEFLOATBLOCK] = l[GETFIELD] =
  111.       l[GETFLOATFIELD] = l[SETFIELD] = l[SETFLOATFIELD] =
  112.       l[BRANCH] = l[BRANCHIF] = l[BRANCHIFNOT] = l[PUSHTRAP] =
  113.       l[C_CALL1] = l[C_CALL2] = l[C_CALL3] = l[C_CALL4] = l[C_CALL5] =
  114.       l[CONSTINT] = l[PUSHCONSTINT] = l[OFFSETINT] =
  115.       l[OFFSETREF] = l[OFFSETCLOSURE] = l[PUSHOFFSETCLOSURE] =
  116.       l[RESUMETERM] = l[REPERFORMTERM] = 1;

  118.     /* Instructions with two operands */
  119.     l[APPTERM] = l[CLOSURE] = l[PUSHGETGLOBALFIELD] =
  120.       l[GETGLOBALFIELD] = l[MAKEBLOCK] = l[C_CALLN] =
  121.       l[BEQ] = l[BNEQ] = l[BLTINT] = l[BLEINT] = l[BGTINT] = l[BGEINT] =
  122.       l[BULTINT] = l[BUGEINT] = l[GETPUBMET] = 2;

  124.     opcode_nargs = l;
  125.   }
  126.   return opcode_nargs;
  127. }

  129. ‌void caml_thread_code (code_t code, asize_t len)
  130. {
  131.   code_t p;
  132.   int* l = caml_init_opcode_nargs();
  133.   len /= sizeof(opcode_t);
  134.   for (p = code; p < code + len; /*nothing*/) {
  135.     opcode_t instr = *p;
  136.     if (instr < 0 || instr >= FIRST_UNIMPLEMENTED_OP){
  137.       /* FIXME -- should Assert(false) ?
  138.       caml_fatal_error ("in fix_code: bad opcode (%lx)",
  139.                             (char *)(long)instr);
  140.       */
  141.       instr = STOP;
  142.     }
  143.     *p++ = (opcode_t)(caml_instr_table[instr] - caml_instr_base);
  144.     if (instr == SWITCH) {
  145.       uint32_t sizes = *p++;
  146.       uint32_t const_size = sizes & 0xFFFF;
  147.       uint32_t block_size = sizes >> 16;
  148.       p += const_size + block_size;
  149.     } else if (instr == CLOSUREREC) {
  150.       uint32_t nfuncs = *p++;
  151.       p++;                      /* skip nvars */
  152.       p += nfuncs;
  153.     } else {
  154.       p += l[instr];
  155.     }
  156.   }
  157.   CAMLassert(p == code + len);
  158. }

  160. #else

  162. ‌int* caml_init_opcode_nargs(void)
  163. {
  164.   return NULL;
  165. }

  167. #endif /* THREADED_CODE */

  169. ‌void caml_set_instruction(code_t pos, opcode_t instr)
  170. {
  171. #ifdef THREADED_CODE
  172.   *pos = (opcode_t)(caml_instr_table[instr] - caml_instr_base);
  173. #else
  174.   *pos = instr;
  175. #endif
  176. }

  178. ‌int caml_is_instruction(opcode_t instr1, opcode_t instr2)
  179. {
  180. #ifdef THREADED_CODE
  181.   return instr1 == (opcode_t)(caml_instr_table[instr2] - caml_instr_base);
  182. #else
  183.   return instr1 == instr2;
  184. #endif
  185. }
